alert.note: Alert for Coles; Douglas; Moultrie (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 1:26PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Illinois, including the following counties, Coles, Douglas and Moultrie. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 123 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Law enforcement also reported water over the intersection of 28th and Commercial in Mattoon. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Charleston, Mattoon, Sullivan, Arcola, Arthur, Lovington, Humboldt, Cooks Mill, Rardin, Coles, Chesterville, Coles County Airport, Fairgrange, Bushton and Cadwell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
